Thursday is a great night to go for the live music - nice place to wind down before the weekend and hang out with friends.  The seating is spread out enough to where you do not feel right on top of the other patrons.
author: Natalie G.

description: Favorite place in the castro! Good wine selection and nice staff.
author: Sophia A.

description: Great place to grab a glass of wine or an appetizer to go along with it. I was at here twice on my visit. Once during happy hour on a Thursday and met a couple friends on Saturday evening before dinner. They definitely are on the busy side, but service was great both times. Great variety of wine selection and great bottle prices. Who was I kidding when I thought we'd only have a glass? Great place for an intimate conversation, small group of friends or sit at the window and people watch.
author: Jes L.

description: Honestly I love this place. Its a great place to come for a glass of wine. The atmosphere is awesome, and service has always been spot on as well. In addition to wine they also serve a small plates menu and brunch, the brunch is to die for, and you can get $9 bottomless mimosas as well.
author: Jason O.

description: This place is so cute inside and the waffles are amazing! Sunday is the best day because it's bottomless mimosa's for $9 with food. The cute and cool chef/owner gal Jen comes out and serves you the food. Great way to start a sunday :)
author: Tracy B.

description:
Blush?  More like "Flush" on Castro...

Won't go here again.  We had a few drinks prior to going in here, and there were four of us.  That equates to a glass each if we ordered a bottle.

But we couldn't order a bottle.  The server said we had already been drinking so SHE COULD ONLY SELL US BY THE GLASS... If we were near drinking too much why serve us to begin with?

Obviously she was trying to get a higher ticket out of us by trying to take advantage - 8 dollars a glass times four, or one bottle for 20 bucks... You do the math...  Not our first time at the rodeo...

The wine wasn't even that great for 8 bucks a glass.  It was bitter and tasted moldy.    

Thats not how you do business people - and as promised, heres your Yelp review.
author: James V.

description:
Are you tired of cheesy bars and guys with bad pick-up lines?  Does the thought of pounding techno music blasting away while you're trying to have a conversation just annoy you?  I SAID, DOES IT ANNOY YOU?  Well, I definitely think this place is worth a try.  I mean...food, wine, friends...what more could you ask for?

I came here at a recommendation of a friend and it did not disappoint.  Located in the heart of Castro, it's unassuming from the outside and when you walk in, it's a very comfortable and casual atmosphere.  They have a wide range of wines to choose from, but I was craving something sweet, so I opted for the Port.  My friends got the Muscat and it was pure goodness.

Hungry?  No problem.  They have a menu of different foods to match your craving including some yummy desserts.  We had the chocolate cake and it was fantastic.

Service is casual, but friendly.  I wouldn't recommend this place for a full meal, but definitely a great hang out spot!
author: Jerome W.

description: Good to see this neighborhood spot packed most times now.  Service a bit slow when ordering munchies.  Menu recently shrunk (got rid of flatbread pizza) and left hungry when we were hoping to eat and drink.  Needs more staff to help with increased demand.
author: John F.

description: This was quite possibly the worst service I have ever had from a wine bar anywhere.  The place wasn't busy and it took forever to get served...the server apparently wasn't interested in taking care of customers.  We finished our first glass and gave up on a second glass after sitting waiting with empty glasses for over 25 minutes.   The cheese plate was way over priced for what you get.  Too many other wine bars in SF to ever consider going here again.
author: Jason F.

description:
Well now I feel bad for my assertion that there are no straight bars in the heart of the Castro.  And yet, right here at the epicenter is a lovely, laid-back wine bar that would be the envy of many a straight neighborhood.  Especially nice is that they've dialed down the romantic pretensions and just given it the lounge-around vibe of a coffee shop (albeit a well-lit and well-appointed one).  Kicking back on the couches with your pals for a Friday night workweek debrief, washed down with a $10 glass of tasty Pinot (the Les Carabenes, I believe), is socializing at its best.  I only wish the waiter had been a little less eager to flirt with our entire group--perhaps he was hoping we were drunk enough to get talked into ordering some of their tempting but pricy tapas.

Also, it was almost too easy to get good seats in here--I can't help but wonder if this place is going to get waaay more popular after it's been open a little longer.
author: Wes M.

description: A wine bar in the Castro that serves brunch.  Yep!  Perfection.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
As wine bars go, this one has a nice vibe. 

Solid selection of wines. Interesting choices of seating. You want a pub table? You want a bar stool? You want a sofa? Take your pick, it's all good.

It's a nice respite from the zaniness of the Castro. You'll like it.
author: TJ P.

description: Great price for bottomless mimosas but there's a catch-- you have to order food with the mimosas. So I recommend getting the waffle with the ham; it's extremely tasty. It comes with maple syrup and this other really good sauce and it's just great.
author: Erika P.

description: My friend and I came here after going to a sing-a-long at the Castro theater! Great location, friendly staff, and lots of wine selection.  Can't beat that!
author: Stephanie C.

description: I love this place, good wine and service! Just a little bit expensive!
author: Federico B.

description: Good place to go try some wine.  There is a big comfy couch in the front.  Try to get it if it is free.  One thing that I like about their menu is that they organize there wines from sweat to dry.  That makes it easier for people like me that don't know anything about wine.
author: Nick F.

description:
Nothing outstanding, but it's not bad either. Laid back, cool, chic ambiance. Nice selection of wines, but I couldn't bring myself to pay that much on a bar-hopping night. And I've been to restaurants with greater selections that actually had descriptions of the wines.

Three suggestions for the owners:

1. Put at least SOME description and tasting notes so people can explore the flavors a bit more and know what they're actually buying/trying.

2. Expand your offerings to include some cheaper alternatives.

3. Come back and ask if we'd like anything else besides just the one time in the beginning.
author: Brad Y.

description:
Great spot to start the evening. The staff was very friendly and talkative. For a few girls exploring the area they were also quite helpful in planning our night. They told us the hot spots and the scene we were in for at each (they were spot on for the most part). 

They had some cheesy blacklight art on the wall and that didn't really scream "classy wine bar" but at least the place wasn't pretentious. Prices were pretty much what I expected (not what I would want to spend on a vodka/tonic but ok for a glass of something special). 

They offer food but having just come from a big dinner I couldn't even stand to look at a food menu. Definitely an enjoyable experience and if ever in SF again, I would check in on the place.
author: Rhonda G.

description:
Service is excellent! Nice wine selection and I love how the place changes the art from local artists regularly. 
The menu looked amazing...so sad I went after dinner! I am going back to try some of the food!!
I did have the french macaroons....AMAZING!!!! I could have probably had 3 orders. PERFECTION!!
author: Kellie N.

description:
Love the owners.  Love Thursday night music.  Love the Wine Selection.  Love that weird appetizer that tastes like ravioli but looks like spinach dip.

Love the art!
author: Catherine L.

description:
If you want to see a perfect example of bad service, you just might have found your place. This is as bad as it gets, folks. 

I've been here twice and had near identical experiences. The atmosphere is nice and it's great to have a wine bar option in the Castro, but service stinks. 

We ordered drinks that never came and fought for the servers' attention many times. It was funny, at one point we were just sitting there laughing at the two servers behind the bar texting on their cell phones, as customers where trying to order more glasses of wine. You could just see money floating out the door as people were giving up and heading out. 

FIx the service and this place would be a great Castro alternative.
author: Ryan L.

description: Great casual vibe for the Castro. Central location, but great for intimate conversation. I loved the selection and the people were friendly and attentive but not overbearing. They have dessert too and the cheese plate is great! The wine selection was pretty good as well.
author: Shannon H.

description: This is a soft cozy place.  The music is not turned up too loudly so you can carry a conversation.
author: Byron L.

description:
Really excited about discovering this little ditty! 

Met some friends here the other night for a drink and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is classy and cozy at the same time. The walls have interesting and conversational art and the ambiance is cool.
 We only came for drinks but, I am eager to come back to try what looks like some reasonably priced yummy foods.  I wasn't a fan of the sangria (thought it was a bit too sweet) but several others where enjoying it but I was happy with my wine just the same. 
The bartender was patient and quick to respond when I did make up my mind. We had a large group but managed to all fit in the area near the front door. It was dangerous sitting on that couch though. After a while I lost all motivation to go anywhere else. I could have (had they let me) stayed there and drank wine all night.

I'll be back!
author: Tuesday C.

description:
Just had a really pleasant evening here.  Wine list is interesting, with a good variety -- and the bartender(ess) was willing to help me decide by listening to what I was in the mood for.  Points!

Smoked trout salad was absolutely DELICIOUS.  I really appreciated the (relative) lack of a dressing - often these things arrive just swimming in something, and this was clean and allowed the trout and the pumpkin seeds to provide the flavor.

Service was perfectly fine and very friendly but not overattentive, which didn't bother me.  If I want help, I have no issue going up to the bar or flagging someone down, which I had to do here.  That may bother some, though, as the other reviews can attest to. No biggie, just go prepared.

And enjoy!  It's a great vibe.
author: JW B.

description:
Had a glass of wine here - it was a truly amazing Spanish Grenache. The service? Well. Let's just say he was hired because he's incredibly good looking.

I ordered the olive tapenade and really enjoyed it. A great snack. I like that the menu is vegan-friendly. I'd come back with wine-loving friends.
author: Malloreigh M.

description:
Really enjoy this place- Have been a couple times now- Service is always extremely friendly !!! Had great warm mulled wine for the holidays as well...
Great apps.
author: ryan H.

description:
Blush is a total hidden gem of the Castro, and I kinda hope it stays that way. This wine bar is fantastic and offers a huge selection of wine. They also serve food and dessert. It's also a pretty good date place. The atmosphere is intimate and very comfortable. There are cozy sofas and quiet areas. I've also been here in the afternoons to do some work and bum off of their free wifi. The bartender on duty the last time I went took very good care of us. They also have an honor system and don't force you to pay after every drink you order. I dig that.

Go visit but don't spread the word too much.

~A
author: Alex C.

description: Smoked trout salad is delicious. Very well balanced; filling, yet light, with a great flavor profile.
author: Jessica R.

description: Excellent place to hang out... Great staff and ambiance! Love the selection of wine and beer. I have been here several times and always like to come back... Peaceful and not so like other Castro bars
author: Ron K.

description: My wife and I stopped here on a Tuesday night in October and was very happy to have done so.  We were visiting from Chicago and were looking for a nice little wine bar to relax in and we found it here.  Really good selection and Christopher, the bartender, was very cool.  Talked to us for about an hour or so.  Thankfully, it wasn't too busy.  Make sure to eavesdrop on some nearby conversations.  You hear some funny stuff.
author: Pete B.

description: Awesome atmosphere, clean restroom, attentive wait staff, and reasonable prices for drinks. Its a must as it attracts many types of people.
author: R C.

description: Sooo all in all I'd say our experience was fun and everyone enjoyed their food (once they got it), but this is NOT a place for groups.  I'd made reservations way in advance, so they knew we were coming, but they had one server for the whole place and we all felt really bad for him, bc man were they not prepared.  First off, when we got there, he told us to hold on sec bc they had lost their menus and he had sent someone next door to go make copies.... Okay.  Then when they brought the copies, they had only made 25 and therefore asked us to be careful with spills (PS the copies were made on regular printer paper, and handwritten).  Then they were out of coffee.  Initially when he was serving us our bottomless mimosas, he was making one at a time, so luckily he started just making pitchers which was a lot better.  But lastly, which was prob most unforgivable, every single person got their food completely separately with the first person and last person's arriving probably within 45 mins of each other.  And then every time the chef finished something, he'd just place it on the side table near the kitchen, so a couple times we'd just grab it ourselves because the poor server was running around trying to keep up.
author: Sonia S.

description: If you want an alternative to hanging out at the bars, this is the perfect space.  They have a nice lounge area in the front with bar seating situated in the front and a couch area. For larger groups, they have tables in the back.  The selection of wines by the glass and bottles are many.  The staff is charming and friendly. They must have a good memory too as you can start a tab and not put a card down.  Sit and move around the lounge area and when you close out, they know exactly what you ordered.  How great is that?
author: Marck N.

description: I really like this atmosphere. You can sit at tables, at the bar, or there is small lounge area. You can order by the glass or by the bottle. Nice if you just want to hang out with a bunch of friends and just get sloshed.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Damn, I wish there was a wine bar where I lived because Blush is super-cool, tres chic and modern establishment.  The whole vibe is cozy and classy with dim lighting great looking people and staff, there was even string quartet playing some jazz music to set the mood.
Obviously, there wine list is very extensive, but they also have a great food menu... including an awesome cheese plate to go with your glass of wine.  Prices are reasonable for this type of place and service was attentive but not intrusive.
This is a great place if you're looking for someplace to have a very chill relaxing night out with your friends and enjoy good conversation, or even a date....
It does get really busy here, so it may be hard to find seating here, but it would definitely be worth the wait.
author: Emmett B.

description: Nice wine selection, friendly bartender.  Ambience was nice too.  The sangria left a little to be desired though...
author: James P.

description: I love this place.  It is never empty nor too crowded. The service is excellent. The wine choices are all spot-on so far. I love the Tempranillo. The smoked trout salad is really perfect. I am so happy this place is in my hood.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Blush makes me blush with pleasure. It's one of my favorite little spots in the Castro. My bestie says it's been zoned as one of my infamous safe-date-spots. And she's right. The best part is, it makes for a great spot to grab a drink with the bestie and catch up on life and it also makes for an entertaining date spot with a hottie. Double duty! In order to be deemed a safe-date-spot a place must have good drinks, good eats, plenty of people and activity and some entertainment always helps in case the date is a dud. 
Blush has three distinct areas. You can hang out in the back part at the community table surrounded by racks of wine. Who doesn't want a room like this in their house? Or you can belly up to the bar. Or you can relax and get cozy on the couch. Sometimes there is live music, which can be too loud for the small space, but they are usually pretty talented so more often than not they are forgiven. 
The wine is good, they always have drink specials and the small plates pair well with the wine. The bartenders are knowledgeable and willing to help you navigate the wine menu; always helpful. 
Yep Blush is all good.
author: Shannon K.

description:
I'm no wine expert, and these days I base my order on the fact that I get splitting headaches from red wines. But I learned an adjective or two from a trip to Sonoma Valley, so I can tell you that the Argentine Malbec that Blush sells by the glass is really buttery!

Perhaps more importantly, the bread here is really delicious and the cheese and savory platters are pretty satisfying. Combined with the extensive drink list, that makes Blush my standby for a low-key girls' night out. But don't forget to sit at the bar, since that's the only way to really get the staff's attention for the check.

Random note: the rotating art on the walls sounds like a good idea, but sometimes I kind of hate what they're showcasing.
author: Sharon W.

description: I really like this place for a quick casual meet up with a friend after work or after dinner. The staff are friendly. The wine choices are amazing. Pinot Gamay...Loved it. Been here a few times and will continue to go back! Always meet amazing people!
author: Neelam M.

description: Cozy wine bar not to far from twin peaks. This place i am sure tends to get packed at times, but we got lucky and were among the handful of people there. Their wine list was pretty extensive, but we quenched our thirst with their killer sangrias, which i must say were some of the best that we have had lately. If you are lucky you will be able to grab a seat on one of the two couches they have. Will definitely return.
author: Raj K.

description: Elliot and Chris are so entertaining!  Love this place,  great wine.  Great atmosphere.  If I lived in SF, I could be here every night.
author: Dan L.

description:
Nice that there is a wine bar in this area. Large selection of wines, though the wine list is very difficult to navigate for someone (ie me) who doesn't know his grapes or regions. Red wines are just listed ranging from light to full bodied. I got a glass from the medium to full range, expecting to find something with at least a little taste, but that wine really should have been on lighter end of the scale. My friend got a much nicer wine, appropriately placed on the light to full scale, though.
Some kind of division of the wine menu in different wine styles, or countries or anything to make selection easier would have been nice.

Atmosphere was nice, though the music selection seemed like it belonged in any other place in the Castro other than a wine bar. Plus music was way too loud. 

I had a Croque Monsieur, and was positively surprised by the accompanying salad. 

So positive about the existence of a wine bar in this location, plus for the food and the selection, but minuses for lack of help making said selection, loud (bad) music. And oh yeah, for some reason they felt the need to keep the door open, which meant the place was way cold.
author: Jesper F.

description: Blush is awesome for a glass of wine on a Wednesday night.... Not recommended for Sunday brunch. The bacon earns this spot one star, beyond the side of bacon, the semi-warm coffee and half a waffle do not encourage a return visit.
author: Ali A.

description: Love this space on week nights...we come for post yoga libations and cozy conversations during the week.  Such a lil gem.  Great atmosphere, low glowy lights, comfy couches and hot flirty bartenders.  Mmmm yes.
author: Christina C.

description: I have already decided to give Blush a second try.  Granted, I arrived right at 4:00pm when they opened the doors.  The minute I walked in I was overwhelmed with the smell of bleach--very much appreciate that the place was clean and clearly cleaned within the last hour but really?  Bleach & Wine wouldn't make for a good name and it is never a good combination--clean it up!  Within a few minutes there were several people gathering and most seemed to be regulars with a happy vibe.  The bartender was fab, attentive & friendly.  I had a glass of the organic chardonnay--very tasty and pleasing.  Nice selection.  Nice barstools.  Nice noise level.  I am certain that sans the overwhelming aroma of bleach, this would be a very nice place to spend time & conversation with friends.
author: Jeff P.

description: I always forget how much I like this place since I only tend to hit the bars when out in the Castro.  But, the food is good, the pours are *mostly* generous and the staff is friendly.  The only thing I would love to have while seated at the bar is a chair with a back!
author: Jimmie L.

description: Blush is a nice alternative to the traditional Castro bar scene.  An out-of-town guest and I stopped in for a little wine and something to nibble on last week.  I was impressed by the wine selection, and while my friend and I only sampled the bruschetta and cheese plate, everything that came out of the kitchen smelled and looked wonderful.  The barkeeps weren't all that friendly, but it could have been an off day.  I'll go back!
author: Ryan B.

description:
It's hard to imagine NOT finding wine bars better than Blush.  The service here is slow and the wine selection is kind of not great.  You can drink better wine at better prices at UVA in the lower haight.  

Back when this place was Bon Port, they used to have lunch specials that would include a crepe and a glass of cider or sparkling wine for a decent price, but I haven't seen that on Blush's menu.  

The only positive thing I can say about Blush is that they have pretty sizable pours.  But you could buy a bottle of equal quality stuff for that price.  Blush is a nice reminder that the best way to drink wine is with friends at home.
author: Luke M.

description: The best place to hang-out of you are tired of the noise from different clubs in Castro. They good wine & good service as well.
author: Michael M.

description:
With its extensive wine list and great selection of varietals, Blush might have to be my new go-to wine bar.  Even though the pours are generous, I managed to drink my way through a sparkling rose, a non sparkling rose then an Australian Mouvedre, while my friend enjoyed a Pinot Grigio and a White Rioja.  Perhaps we drank so much because the food was so good... 

My favorite was the cheese and charcuterie platters.  I wish I could remember the cheeses we were served because they were divine and the dried sausage/salumi was also delicious... accompanied by a yummy country bread and I don't usually eat bread. 

We sat at the bar so we could talk to the friendly staff but the peeps sitting around the different lounge areas looked really comfy. 

For being in the Castro, there was a good mixed crowd.  Been here twice in one week... will definitely be back... as long as my liver can take it!
author: Lorraine F.

description:
I REALLY want to like this place, but it's just too damn difficult to get a glass of wine.

I've been here twice now. Neither time have I been promptly greeted after sitting down. It's always a matter of chasing a server down, or heading up to the bar, waiting and hoping I'll be acknowledged.

I do like the space, the chill, low-key atmosphere, and how it offers a welcome break from the craziness and noise of other bars in the neighborhood.  But, if I go to a wine bar, I want the ability to get a glass of wine, easily -- or at least some service -- rather than just sitting 10 minutes at a table, waiting, being ignored. Until they get the service aspect down, I'll happily stick with Hotel Biron, Yield, Press Club and the many other great wine bar options around town.
author: Daniel P.

description: For an average wine bar that offers nothing special or original the attitudes of bar tenders and wait staff are unnecessarily elitist and pretentious. Whether or not they are purposefully trying to cater to the GLBT community or that is just a consequence of Blush being located in the Castro, it is not a smart business practice to discriminate against heterosexual customers and couples looking to grab a glass of wine like every other paying customer. I could have done without being ignored or treated  with static. Tolerance and acceptance should be practice by all to all.
author: Culinary C.

description:
I was so pleasantly surprised by this place! While waiting for a table at Starbelly, we stumbled upon Blush. 8:30pm on a Friday night - no wait, ample seating, instant service

The wine list has great wine by the glass prices, and featured my favorite grenache from Spain. It was funny because we initially tried to go to Catch to get some oysters, but it was too crowded....and guess what Blush has on the menu? Kumamoto oysters...1/2 dozen for $11! Score!

Side note: Blush has the best use of space I've seen in San Francisco. The layout of the bar allows for SO much seating but manages to still give off that "cozy" feel. A great place for a date or pre-dinner drinks!
author: Hannah L.

description: Lovely selection of wines from around the world, knowledgeable wine servers who enthusiastically allow tastings to help you find the perfect fit before purchasing, charming atmosphere, love the velvet sofas. I wish they had a few more food options. But this is really a cozy, relatively low key place. Some wines are a bit pricey, but this is SF after all.
author: John C.

description: My partner and I come here every Thursday for the live band, great service, and one of a kind ambiance. We love this place!! If you haven't gone... Go on Thursdays!! :) Thanks Blush.
author: Alan A.

description:
Here are my two cents: Rude & unfriendly service. Below average wine selection.

I have visited Blush three times now and I have been consistently disappointed. There are, however, certain aspects that I enjoy about this bar. I love the location (love the Castro), enjoy the live music provided on certain nights, and can appreciate the lively vibe of the place. HOWEVER, I can't get over the feeling that the bartenders could really give a s*&t about actually getting me a glass a wine. 

The wine selection has expanded. They do offer a better selection of wine than they did a year or so ago, but it is still rather lacking. 

I haven't tried the food here.  But after our last experience here, my girlfriend and I agreed to never step foot in here again, so I guess I won't be tasting the menu. 

I don't give up easily on a place (especially a wine bar) I feel like I was supposed to love...but alas, I have given up on Blush.
author: Patricia Z.

description: I went tonight and got some nice white wine, some nice red wine and a Leffe on tap.  Good food too.  Nice spot to chill and relax and drink and talk.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Wanted to kill some time before going to the clubs. The location is excellent as it is in the center of everything in the Castro. Very laid back atmosphere, like a neighborhood bar. They have a pretty good selection of wines and beers. I'm more of a red wine type, so just ordered those all night. Started out with the Malbec, which was good. Ordered small plates of olive tapenade and bruschetta. The pairing went well. Second glass I went with Bordeaux, partner went with a Cabernet. We firgured we'll be staying a while longer so ordered the cheese plate as well. Yum, loved the cheeses and jams. For our last glass, the server recommended some other red wine which I forget the name of.. by this time we were pretty tipsy haha. But it was good! The server really warmed up to us, he started smiling by the end and actually started recommending wines. So I'd say pretty friendly staff. The crowd was eclectic, all sorts. But all seemed pretty happy and enjoying themselves. It's not too loud either, you can carry conversation without screaming. We had a really good time here. And it was perfect plan because almost midnight and we headed out into the streets, wine and cheese happy.. ready to dance! We'll be back!
author: Vol T.

description:
The only bad thing: the French guy who works there on Sun, Mon, Tues... he's not very helpful, and is sorta sketchy.

Comfortable seating, very good appetizers (love the seafood assortment platter..with anchovies in lots of oil and smoked fish), and a very extensive wine list. The clientele are very nice, always smiling faces and easy to converse with.

I like the Spanish wines, and the blush (rose's), the pink bubbly is fantastic.

the CONS:  staff aren't too friendly, nor "on the ball", they seem distracted, and often don't take your plates and utensils away after finished eating. The staff aren't "rude", they are just a bit distant, and don't engage in small talk (which is not how San Francisco bartenders should be), only a minor complaint: a bit stuffy, needs better ventilation

All in all, I'd recommend the place to someone seeking a comfortable place to try all sorts of wines and bubbly, without all the pretense.
author: Ted K.

description: I'm down with the friendly staff. Definitely down with the laid back atmosphere. Kinda gives you a breather from the rest of Castro. Lovely set up inside. Super comfy couch. Plenty of space at the bar, side tables and a big community table. Good lighting. Little warm inside (and no, not just from the wine.) Got a nice bottle of syrah from South Africa's darling cellar Onyx. Cheese plate was super tasty.
author: Naomi K.

description:
I can not believe I lived a few blocks away from here for almost a year and had never tried it. This place is absolutely wonderful. It's quiet and has excellent decor, not to mention Delicious wines and polite and helpful bartenders. This is the kind of place that is almost too hip for it's own good, but it's still quite a gem. 

For those of you, like me, who don't enjoy hot, loud and cramped bar scenes, stop in here on a sunday evening for a very nice calm glass of wine. 

bonus pointsfro having couches, this place makes me want to buy a bottle of wine and sit around knitting for awhile. Of course, who knits in a bar?
author: Allyson S.

description:
I love their dessert wine. So good.

I spilled my first glass but the server didn't charge me for my clumsy mistake. He received a hefty tip. The atmosphere was very laid back. I liked that a lot. Nothing like going to crowded clubs, which I dislike.

I will definitely come back.
author: Bianca B.

description:
Cool ambiance, nice French dude behind the bar, and some interesting wines. Definitely a nice, different option for when you're in the Castro, or when Swirl on Castro is closed later in the night. 
Overall, prices are ok, taking San Franflation into account. The 10oz. (2 glass) carafe of house red for $7 was actually pretty decent and not a bad value at all. Several $4 apps also a good option for some nibbles with your tipples and they have some cheese plates, salads, and more if you wanna throw down some dollbills. 
Plus, they have legit coffee and beer (Stella, Hoegaarden, and Leffe(!)) and always offer water, which is nice. Oh, and live music sometimes.
Service was a little slow (there was a big private party, 1 guy to take all the orders, and for some reason it was packed on a Weds. night), but still friendly.
author: Kelly N.

description:
EDIT:  Downgrading to 3 stars because the service is definitely spotty.

Yay wine bar in the Castro!

Went here last night and really enjoyed the ambiance and the hot french guy behind the bar.

The wine wasn't too expensive, the pours were pretty generous and overall it was a nice change of pace.

Not quite at five stars yet because this place is still establishing itself, and because it was super hot in there considering the lack of a large crowd.  That said, PLEASE come here and keep this open.  Yay!
author: Evan L.

description:
My wife and I frequent this establishment. There are many things to love about it...

1. Wine list is fantastic and changes often. 
2. Food menu is simple with a mixture of french and american dishes. The range of sizes is excellent. I do, however, wish they would add some Gluten-Free options such as GF crackers with the cheese, etc. 
3. Ambiance is very casual and enjoyable. The crowd varies depending on the day and the local events.
4. Service is great with extremely friendly staff who are both helpful and knowledgeable about the wines they are serving.
5. Price point is reasonable and the specials are nice. 

Points for improvement as mentioned above include additional GF foods and more involvement in the local community activities. 

Bottom Line: We love it here. It is our favorite wine spot in the city and the 5 stars are well earned.
author: Min M.

description:
Blush is quite possibly one of my most favorite places in the Castro. It's classy, fun, well staffed, and just about perfect.

Their wine selection is varied and unique, plus it's updated by season. Nearly anyone will be able to find a wine here that will satisfy them. The food and snack items are also perfect accompaniments to the wines. Especially nice are the meat and cheese platters. They're a perfect amount for 2-4 people to graze on while sipping away on delicious local and abroad wines.

The staff is spot-on. They're extremely well informed, and can explain or describe every bottle on the menu. They are all attentive, friendly, mildly flirtatious, and overall eager to assist you in your wine selection. They're more than willing to offer suggestions, or attempt to tailor your drink purchase to your palette and preferences. 

Interestingly, for a wine bar, the place is very much not pretentious. It's decor is casual, and inviting. The seating isn't fancy, but nonetheless welcomes you to sit and stay a while with a group of friends. Sometimes light, unobtrusive music is playing. The place never reaches a volume level where normal conversation can't be had.

If I had to knock Blush, it'd be the cost. Many of their wines are international, and thereby carry an international price. The snacks are also a little more pricey than one would expect. Still, it's a bar, so what do you expect? Plus, the atmosphere and service well out-shadow any negative feelings about price. 

Truly, one of the best places in the Castro for friends and drinks.
author: Adam G.

description:
It's a shame I can only give this place two stars. Unfortunately the service dragged down the rating. 

I had been wanting to stop by and experience 'Blush' for quite some time now and while walking past one weekend afternoon I noticed the wine list (posted outside) had been expanded so thought I'd pop in. 

So we sat at the bar and waited and waited while the server chatted to a friend of his who was sitting just a couple of stools away. The 'friend' sat there texting with no drink or food in front of him just taking up space. We still sat there and waited and... oh good thanks, a menu appears and then the server returns to his buddy and continues to chat. Finally obtaining the servers attention, we at last got to order 2 glasses of wine. The entire time I want to keep an open mind and really wanted to like this place. 

Now the servers friend leaves and in walks another friend of his and sits on the sofa behind us. Immediately the server walks off to sit on the sofa arm and chat to his next friend. Another customer was standing at the bar with his check in hand wanting to cash out - server ignores his customer and prefers to spend his time chatting to yet another friend who is not ordering a thing and not making a single penny for the house. 

The customer finally has enough and walks over to the server perched on the sofa arm to advise he wants to pay. 

By this time we've had enough - check please - Hello? any one there? 

We ain't goin back. Too bad, cuz this place has potential, but with the poor service and 12 bucks for a glass of wine you're better off elsewhere. 

.,
author: Bobby J.

description: Wow - quite a disappointment in terms of service.  I sat down to a dirty bar with two plastic bottles of orange soda on it. The first bartender apologized and cleared them away without me prompting her - fine, right?  She left - never to be seen again and never offered me a menu.  So, the other bartender cones over and we select a pinotage.... He continued to serve around a dozen other glasses of wine to other customers and doesn't say another word... I quietly got up and left the bar and the doucXXbag didn't even notice.. Service really stunk here today and it's not the first time it's been bad...
author: Robert H.

description: I dont know even remember how did I end up to this place. the champagne was good and the people who was taking care of me was nice. . now after see my online statements. everything star coming back in my mind  but I had a great nite a couple days ago . i think was the weekend. who cares. Most people in the place were really friendly w me.
author: Cesar E.

description:
Blush is a really cute wine bar with really tasty food.  Went with a friend on a Saturday night and we both enjoyed our wine ($12 wine flights), food (cheese plate, escargot, smoked trout salad and raw oysters) and the company of the friendly couple sitting next to us at the large communal table.

It is a bit pricey (I think it came out to around $70 for the both of us before tax & tip), but I really enjoyed the ambiance of the place.  It was nice because it wasn't pretentious at all and was as comfortable as a cafe.  It wasn't too crowded and the waiter was attentive and knowledgeable.
author: Amy C.

description: This is one of my favorite wine bars in the city. Such a great place to grab drinks with a few friends (notice I didn't say a group). They have a wide array of wines to suit your needs, whether you want to splurge or be cheap. It's rarely too crowded or too noisy and the staff are genuinely friendly. Also, their bathroom is always like 80º and smells like gardenia. I could sleep in there.
author: K M.

description:
great wine bar. great location! 

came here with a big group and we were able to join the tables in the back to fit all 10 of us. they had a great selection of wines by the glass. and also food for when you get hungry! we came on a wednesday night after work and it wasn't too busy so we were still able to hear each other talk and have a chill night! would recommend!
author: Jen S.

description:
have frequented Blush several times and the food and wine are great. Tonight, however, I arrived with three friends and BEFORE we even sat down, I was told to leave by the barman. 

After having a good look at him, I realized that he IS part o0f the heterosexualisation of the Castro!!!!!!!!     I am early 50's and do not fit the criteria of many local places. Whomever he is, he treated me like I was dirt, and I was with friends after dinner. I came home, watched TV and then got angry and felt compelled to write this. I LOVE Blush, but this treatment is appalling and wrong. I Believe (not know) that it is age discrimination. I am older, but not ugly, but the barman made it obvious that he is the ugly one.

Sorry folks, I was born and raised 2 blocks away from there and this is the treatment I receive. Sad times are more than fast upon us..................:-(
author: M D.

description: When wine bars in Florida have a wider selection... yikes. Service did seem very friendly, but my disappointment is still fresh having stepped off a plane from the tropical outpost and in search of great Bay Area wine. We landed in Blush with some old friends and about the only really positive part of the experience was the terrific company. Everything else was just ok...
author: Brian P.

description: Really great wine spot and I certainly do love my wine!!! They have a lot of wines to choose from and the overall environment is cozy. DId I mention the ravioli will change your life, seriously, try it-you won't be sorry. I would give 5 stars BUT the woman who was bartending was just rude and cold--not quite sure how she fits in there considering everyone else is kind and welcoming. Will go back for sure but not when that mean lady is working.
author: Pita Q.

description:
Perhaps my favorite bar in the Castro. 

It has the feeling of a pub, in that you can sit back on a plush couch or chair, and actually talk to people. The staff is friendly, the ambiance is warm (with frequently changing art by local artists), and the wine selection is fantastic. 

This is a low key place, where you can sit back, have an appetizer before heading off to dinner, or return later in the evening for some desert and a port (or really anything on the wine list). 

On a warm day the front windows open up, on a cold day... well, they are closed... no fire place though (but one would not be out of place). 

In the back is a fantastic long table, which when things are crowded (which is rare, but on occasion happens), you will find intermingling groups of patrons, often times sharing bottles of wine with one another (or really, maybe that is just our group festooning our wine onto people... same thing, really... right?).
author: Jordan Y.

description:
Came here on a Saturday evening. The atmosphere appeared to be mixed (straight and gay). The wine was pretty good and I got about 4 glasses for $33. If i lived in SF i would probably frequent this place....
Sidenote: There was a naked guy standing on the street with his underwear in his hand. He only wore a pair of trainers and a skully. before he entered Blush he put on his underwear and covered his bits and pieces.......Only in the castro.
author: T X.

description:
I would have to say that I liked when it was Au Bon Port.  But seasons change.  I enjoyed getting a really juicy red wine here and sinking into the velvet of the couches, contemplating the abstract artworks on the walls.  Once I was there and they had a 3-piece string band that was kind of jazzy-funky-classic.  Is there such a genre?  Hmmm.  I remember ordering a dessert there that was mind blowing, I think it was a dessert crepe or tiramisu or something.

Final opinion, any wine bar is a good thing.  They have a little something for every palette by the glass or buy a bottle, still or bubbly.  Easy to find right across the street from the Castro Theatre.
author: Arturo S.

description:
Excited to enjoy a glass of wine after a stressful day traveling to see a doctor in the SF area, my husband and I happened in on what appeared to be a nice wine bar. We entered and approached the bar to find the man behind the counter engrossed in bookkeeping, with books and papers spread out on the bar. We stood there for a minute waiting to be acknowledged.  Since he couldn't  deign to lift his head or even mumble a greeting, I picked up the only wine list on the bar/in sight, and began to look at it. It was laying (closed) on the bar near the only patron at the time, whose back was turned and whose drink had already been set in front of him.  Then (suddenly and rather abruptly) as if to "reprimand" me for "taking" this patron's wine list, the bartender paused from his bookwork to snatch the list from my  hands, slap it  back down on the bar in the spot from where I had picked it up, and, reach under the counter to produce two other identical wine lists, which he again literally slapped down on the counter in front of my husband and me. This was done deftly,  as he never ONCE looked up from his work.... OR SPOKE.
It was very pointed, very discourteous, extremely amateur, and a huge hint-and-a-half as to why the place was dead at 5:25 pm.  Needless to say it was a buzz-kill, and we left, just as he seemed to want us to leave.  So tacky. 

 This was around 5:30 on Thursday, October 28th,2010,  if anyone with any authority (and business sense) from BLUSH happens to be reading this.
author: Lisa J.

description:
Great spot to have a few glasses of generally excellent wine.  They have great nibbles including cheese, meats, olives and this incredible tapenade! 

My only ding is that the seating can be uncomfortable unless you grab one of the front couches.

I've not had the service problems others seem to have had, in fact I've never had anything but top notch service there!
author: Jason H.

description:
This place is adorable and I'll come back but both times I've been, the service has been very slow.

Last time, we had to wait almost 40 minutes after we finished for the check.  We weren't in a rush but it was hard to get the server's attention and I was getting sleepy.  They have comfy couches that may have also added to my fatigue.

The first time I went with a group and one friend arrived later.  The server did notice and come over right away to take her order...he just never came back with her wine!  Eventually we flagged him down and immediately he felt bad.  We were cool though.  He had to come back again to remember what she ordered.  When he finally brought it out, he told her it was on the house.  We weren't expecting that, but nice!

So slow service, but good service.

They have a decent selection of wines, and their house red (which comes in a carafe amounting to about a glass and a half), is a yummy tempranillo instead of the typical blah cab or merlot.  I approve of that.
author: Marissa B.

description:
A friend of mine has taken me to Blush twice now and both times it turned out to be nights with receptions for artists opening shows of their art on the walls of Blush.  Despite it being a cozy, casual place, those particular nights were very high energy mixing regulars with artists and art admirers. I had a fabulous time. met alot of new people,  and found everyone very friendly.  Love the comfy couches and chairs.

They have a pretty good list of wines and reasonable prices.  The food is very good too;  I particularly liked the cheese plate to nibble on with the wine.  

Blush has become one of my new favorite places, so I'll be back often.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Blush is a great place to enjoy some wine, light food, conversation and good atmosphere. It's very comfortable and pleasant, especially when you can sit on the sofas. We can spend hours here, and usually do!

Jacob is great. He knows his wines, offers good recommendations and makes you feel right at home. I love how he greets regulars with a hug when they walk in and gives 'em another on the way out. He helps make this a true neighborhood hangout for gay and straight!
author: Rodd A.

description: This place has become one on my regular hang out with friends and its a great casual place meet a 1st date!! Great selection on wines by the glass and good small bite foods. If you see Jennifer behind the bar you know its going to be a great night!
author: lorrin S.

description: This place does make you blush. Very warm inside and with a glass of wine. You're done! Great recommendations from the staff. I like how the place is not too tiny that you're tripping over others feet, but still has a cozy feeling. Laid-back place to go with friends or on a first date. Noise level is not too high, so you can have a conversation. If you like Syrah, try a bottle from Onyx South Africa and pair it with a cheese plate.
author: Farah S.

description: Beautiful selection of wines, food that is classically clean and yummy, great view and fantastic customer service.  Keep it up!
author: Michelle A.

description: It's a cool and chill place to just sit back and enjoy a nice glass of wine. The place is pretty small, but I really enjoy the atmosphere. I know very little about wine, but the staff were helpful and very friendly. I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Irene L.

description: It was a rainy night.  A friend that I was supposed to meet up with for dinner cancelled at the last moment.  I decided to have dinner anyway.  On the way back to the car I walk past Blush.  This amazing jazz trio is playing so I had to go inside.  The wine is a little pricey and portions are not generous but what a cozy, comfortable, relaxed place!  I'll be back!
author: John P.

description: Helpful staff and wide variety of wines. Overall we had a great experience. It's quite overpriced, especially the cheese plate with tiny slivers of cheese, good cheeses but way too much money for what we got. They also don't offer flights and just single glasses or bottles which is a bummer.
author: M S.

description: This is my favorite wine bar and I frequent it often. I love the ambiance, a few couches, tables and chairs for larger parties, and a stool at the bar if you feel like chatting to staff or a stranger. Their specials are always fun to try, they also always have a few good zin on their list. I enjoy their food as well. Being a vegetarian I have tried the pizza, ravioli, cheese plate, and grilled cheese salad(yum).
author: max k.

description: Very nice wine food n vibes.  Just bit too noisy and tad bit over priced for what it is. Good service and welcoming space on Castro. Overall very refreshing
author: Rick N.

description: This place is certainly a nice place to relax when it's not crowded.  I'm in total agreement about not spreading the word.  It's not a typical cruisey type of joint.  It's a wine bar with light menu of food.  The service is not bad, but I've been going there more as an after work type of thing.  The prices are a tad much, but I think of this place of more of an escape.  The jazz musicians that play there are also very entertaining...overall, this is a nice place during the slow times.  They do have wifi, but i'm not a big fan of people coming there to take up space and ignore the musicians.  The service also does tend to suffer when there are a lot of people there.  But overall, Blush is great.
author: Criss R.

description: This wine bar is totally underrated, especially because of it's location.  The ambiance is great and the wine selection is fantastic.  Any of their Malbecs are fantastic.  There's always people there chatting over several glasses of wine and it's never too crowded....perfect for relaxing after a long day at work or just catching up with friends.  For being in the Castro, this place is a good mix of straight and gay clients.  If you're expecting to be acknowledged the moment you step into the place, Blush is not for you.  If you want a little more relaxed atmosphere in the heart of the Castro, stop by, unwind and grab yourself a Malbec.
author: Ben T.

description: LOVE this wine bar! The people who work there are super friendly and NOT pretentious and still know about wine! And sometimes you can catch a band playing in the corner some lovely jazz or swing. This wine bar just has a really nice feel to it. I love to go as often as I can.
author: Carol B.

description:
I really, really wanted to love Bush!, but--well--I like to get the food that I order and that didn't  happen.

The scenario: Saturday night, date night for my girlfriend and me. We were planning on a nice glass of wine (which, thankfully, we got), some small plates, and maybe a dessert.

We got our wine and small plate and all was good, minus the fact that we could not get the attention of the bartender or waiter, who were much more attuned to the cute boys than to us.

Enter an order for extra bread and a dessert. Watch the waiter give both of these to the next table. Try to get someone, anyone's attention. Wait some more. Finally, go to the bar and tell the bartender that we need to leave post haste. 

Hold your tongue while the bartender offers to give you your dessert for free, even though you just told him that you have you have to leave NOW. 

Tip exactly 15%, then leave, sad because you didn't get your chocolate fondant but excited to see your movie.

The end.
author: Alison P.

description: Went here for an art show, definitely not the right place for it, this bar is about 15 feet wide. Far too cramped to see everything without stepping on, through or around everyone in the bar. Probably a good place to go if you're on a date or catching up with one friend, but it's really small.
author: Matt F.

description: Gosh I got so tipsy here with my friend Cynthia B.  And I was so gone that my eyes were so small (..-er than it is right now..) the atmosphere and interior is so cute and dark, kinda loud though.  There's a bunch of creepy paintings of goth chicks everywhere but it's cool, they looked pretty hot to me, or maybe I was already quite drunk and high?  It's in the castro, so naturally many gays and lesbians will frequent the place.  The bartenders are soo nicee and awesome. Awww..  I love drinking
author: Frankie W.

description: We live in Noe Valley and were looking for a fun wine lounge to go to when my friend was visiting. We were going to try Le Zinc, but after reading reviews on Yelp it appears people go there for the food and not so much the wine lounge. We went here instead and LOVED it! They had a great selection, great prices, and it was the perfect crowd (not too many people, but not too few). I'm definitely going here again!
author: Steven M.

description: continuing on castro march...after-dinner hours...wine for dessert?...blush appearance dim, quaint and serious....wine serious....shelves and boxes of wine around...walls and floors...wine and more wine...good clutter...order of cheese and favorite pinot grigio....owner recommendation of reds....and splash of port...few wine enthusiasts amoungst group...longer chit chat before deciding....personal service a plus....a generous complimentary pour another plus....although group of naked banana hammock and top hat wearing men quite the disturbing scene...."this is the castro!"....fine wine bar nonetheless...for wine indulgence...
author: Hen A.

description: An oasis in a desert of well drinks. A raft in a sea of dance floors. What a pleasure it is to find a classy place on castro with no crowds were you can enjoy a bottle of cava with friends.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: If you like a little lack of service that pairs nicely with a Bordeaux, or perhaps some snark to offset the oak finish of a Chardonnay then this might be your place. It would almost be worth grinning it and bearing it, since the place has such a cozy and warm feel, more reminiscent of a cafe than a wine bar, but being treated poorly just shouldn't have such a high profit margin.
author: Drue C.

description: I am so happy I live near this place. So cute and cozy inside. Went to see my cousin's art hanging on the wall, and it looks amazing with their dark red walls! I loved the wine selection, especially the muscat- super sweet! Definitely will be coming back- hopefully soon!
author: Sonya D.

description: I would have to say this place is not bad. . . I like it.  Its got good seating arrangements, good wines (wished they had flights though), and hello, pate and raw oysters.  They even had tabasco.  Perfect way to win my heart.  So I say, winner, winner, chicken dinner.
author: Janice F.

description: A delightful alternative to the typical Castro meat market bars in the area.  Cozy and welcoming, you'll never have to scream over the ambient music.  An eclectic and surprising wine list makes you want to stay till last call.
author: Natalie R.

description: Now that Blush is more established, the service has improved.  I am now more likely to keep the place in mind because it is convenient and their wine selection is very good.  The front sitting area is "cozy", except that the last time I was there I noticed that the couches were absolutely filthy and full of stains...it didn't look like they even made an attempt to keep them clean.  It felt weird drinking a $12 glass of wine on such a nasty couch.
author: Eddie C.

description:
So I was entertaining some out of towners and you can't name a more interesting scene than the castro........on any other night than the OSCARS! With absolutely nothing going on in this sudden ghost town we bumped into a sign for a wine bar that read " Great wine, delicious food and cute bartenders." DONE.  We walked in and demanded to see the cute bartenders.  Fully satisfied by their combined adorableness, we looked at the list for .05 seconds and made our second demands known;we want great wine!  OMG delicious! And the decor was so warm and inviting; my guests were happy, I was happy, Sandra Bullock was the happiest.  To top it off, as soon as I took that first delicious sip, I look over and see my long lost friend! What are the odds that someone awesome that you meet in one wine bar (Nectar in burlingame) you will re-connect with in another wine bar?! ( I hate it when people say, "small world," 'cause it is NOT small, but I admit I was thinking it.  
I didn't have any of the food, but from what I saw, it has to be good! Trust me, I have seen a lot of food.
We actually took a cab there and back from the Fillmore area and it was pretty cheap, but I can't speak for parking.  Let's just guess that it might be a pain.  
Yeah, OK, it's a BAR, so If you want more wine you have to go up to, wait for it............THE BAR. (I can't believe an earlier yelper commented on that!)  
Thanks for the relaxing experience, 
JuJu
author: Juju C.

description: Nice place to hang out with friends or perhaps to take someone on a date.  Nice ambiance and the owner that is from Belgium with a french accent is soo damn cute!
author: Jasen L.

description: It sounds like a nightclub in Castro, but it's not... it's a wine bar in Castro, okay!?? Wine bar!! Now, you might want to temper my review with another, because I'm not a big wine officianado. Okay, I'm being modest-- I'm actually well-versed in wine, having had to take several classes and tasting hundreds of bottles as a server in one of the east coast's biggest country club chains. I can wax philosophical about the different vineyards all around the world, including the virtues of the soil, climate and overall practices, which all serve to make the wine in your glass unique (read: marketable). My knowledge is bigger than yours. *pets knowledge* But look, let's not make this all about me. The point is, Blush serves wine that's about on par with all the others in the surrounding neighborhoods. But where it separates is the atmosphere they've created. It's snooty enough in a nouveau sophisticate kind of way but without the caustic venom from the clientele that wine bars such as this will tend to draw. By this I mean that the people here are cool, and the food pairings that the staff suggests are on point with the wine bottle on your table. If you're here, ask for Willem. He knows his stuff and he's just about the nicest guy you could meet in San Francisco.
author: H.R. N.

description: Considering the appearance and atmosphere of Blush, I was very disappointed in the service.  The two men working the bar were not so much rude as uncaring.  After sitting with an empty glass for 15 minutes and trying to get the attention of one of the staff, I finally tried to flag one of them down as he walked by me.  He looked at me and then walked on.  I would be a little more understanding if he were quite busy, but it was a fairly slow night.  After finally getting another glass of wine, I watched as a table of people spent half an hour trying to get the attention of the servers.  Unfortunately, the two servers were too busy doing something on their cell phones to notice.  After all of this they gave me a tab for 6 glasses of wine when I had only ordered three.  There are far better places to get a glass of wine.
author: Brandon J.

description: Not cheap, but its a nice diversion from the loud, trendy clubs. You can actually hear the person you're having a conversation with. Typical wine bar atmosphere. Skimpy portions on the cheese plate. $7+ for a glass of wine.
author: Mr. E.

description: LOVED this place!!! I stopped in here while I was waiting for a friend to go to the Cafe. I ended up staying here 3 hours and wishing I never left to go to the Cafe. It was a nice mixed crowd which is hard to find. The atmosphere was great and the wine list extensive They even had the Malbec I liked. Everyone was very friendly including the bartender's mom who was a lovely woman and in town visiting her son. I went back last night and it hasn't even been a week yet. Can't wait to take a date here:)
author: Kaile B.

description: Not really sure why people keep writing bad reviews about service at Blush. Every time I have been here my service has been stellar. This includes Willium, Jeff, and Gabriel, who have all made me feel welcome and at home...  My favorite wine is a pinot grigio from Italy. The cheese plate and olives are divine. The ambiance is cozy, warm and inviting. Really looking forward to live music on Thursdays featuring gypsy jazz... Please give this place a chance, you won't regret it!!
author: chloe r.

description: A great little place for a bar scene alternative to enjoy a glass of wine or champagne and even forget your on Castro Street.  Very cozy and romantic but they close at midnight.
author: Matthew G.

description: I have been going to Blush since they transformed from a coffee bar to a wine bar. Great location to dip inside and chill with a glass / bottle of wine before you make your way home from work. I like the low-key chill - not all hyped up like other wine bars. The music varies from ambient to jazz depending on the night. I have always had good service here. And yeah like other reviewer this is a stumble to my house so easy to get to. I wish the Castro had more wine bars - the full on bar seen seems so 80's sometimes. Oh and you can follow Blush on twitter like I do. http://twitter.com/BlushWineBar
author: Jan K.

description: I love Blush. Great ambiance, perfect for a relaxing evening with a few friends. Another plus is the bartenders pour a very generous glass of wine. I do wish they offered wine flights though.
author: angela i.

description: Love this place! It's hands down my favorite after work, weeknight spot.  My friends and I are regulars here and the staff is just wonderful. There are a lot of regulars who come here to enjoy the ambiance of this laid back, fun wine bar. Try the ravioli dish. It's to die for delicious. Also, there cheese plates are tasty. Currently my favorite wines there are... the vacqueyras, the pinot nior, and the sancerre.  If your bartender is Willem... he's my favorite!
author: Kate W.

description: This is a nice alternative to the bars in the Castro.  The wine list is decent but not stunning.  The prices are a bit high, but it is a wonderful place to gather with friends.  The menu includes a few appetizers and the wine list has expensive and cheap options.  Enjoy!
author: Ron S.

description:
This is a great place for a good glass of wine at reasonable prices.  They have a large selection of both white and red wines from throughout the world.  Moreover, they change the wine list regularly, adding new and interesting wines.  I have tried a number of wines from $7 to $15 and find them all interesting and tasty.  Most wine bars in San Francisco have few if any wines below $10, but I can always find one at Blush under $10 that I like.  Blush gives you the opportunity to select from a broad range of wines by the glass.  The bartenders are most helpful in assisting you with your selection by describing the wines that are offered and offering a taste if you are unsure. The bar snacks are also tasty and healthy. 

This is a good place in the Castro where anyone can feel comfortable ....... Your parents, your grandmother, your boy friend or girl friend will all feel welcome and comfortable.  It has a nice modern European feel. It is casual and comfortable, and has a pleasant vibe.
author: Jerry H.

description: One of our favorite places ... good wine and atmosphere.  Jacob is great - he remembers his clients and recommends really good wines.  A personal touch.  We would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.
author: Phil D.

description: In the heart of the Castro, Blush is far from being your typical Castro venue. It is too gay to be straight, yet too straight to be gay. It is too peaceful to be noisy yet too happening to be quite. It is too elegant of a place to be casual, yet too comfortable of a place to be chic. The place has character, charm, good house wine and tapas. I would go there again and again and again as long as I live in the Castro. And the Hungarian bartender is the sweetest
author: Aaron U.

description: I like this little wine bar on Castro. Every time I have been here they have had live music and the staff is always really friendly. The atmosphere is definitely different from any of the gay bars on Castro which is good if you are looking for a relaxing environment. Also, their staff introduced me to the magic of Malbec, so this will remain my top choice of wine bars because of that!
author: Tyler D.

description: I've been here several times and so far have had good experiences. Wish the wine list included more napa/sonoma/russian river wines but still a decent comprehensive list. The service is European style, not rushed and knowledgeable. My favorite item at this bar is by far the escargot. The escargot has just the right flavors, is served in the shells and tastes delicious.
author: R J.

description: I really want to give more stars for the food and wine. In fact, I usually rate based more on food, but the service just sucked. We were there this past Sunday night. First the good: Couple glasses (big ones) of wine, oysters, and the fancy meat plate= all very yum. The bad: Read Bobby J's review, that is pretty much the experience we had. Most of the customers were seated at the bar, my girlfriend and I were one of like two parties at a table, and we repeatedly had to get the guy's attention (who was drinking and chatting with someone sitting at the bar) to order, get the check, etc. He was nice enough, but seriously, if you see two people sitting and staring at you, with empty glasses and plates in front of them, you might want to check on them.
author: Abby S.

description:
Wine Good, Food Good, Service is Shit, and the place is a little "tired" looking.

I was in the Castro yesterday after working out and wanted a beverage but did not want to pay a cover charge for a horrible experience and crappy drink. We all settled on Blush since we had never been.

After sitting down for like 20 minutes, we finally went to the Bar to place our order and still had to wait even more. There was only one person at the bar and the place was packed, I sincerely hoped someone called out sick and thus the lack of staffing.

We had the cheese plate and the eggplant dip to go along with our glasses of wine. I ordered a glass of bubbly since I was in the mood for something a little more. However, they had run out, come on, how to you run out of Roerder!!!! I was perturbed, but relaxed, and had a glass of the 5ive Russian pinot which was AMAZING!!!!! Highly recommend this pinot.

If you at all remember this place from before, they somewhat shotty cafe/crepe/coffee/something place then you will remember the decor, it is oddly similar (as in they did nothing except hang lights from the ceiling and shortened the bar area).

After enjoying our drinks and a short time of people watching, we decided it was time to leave. We had to wait longer for our bill to be run up.

This place is wonderful in the sense that it isn't a bar/club that is typical of the Castro and offers something else if you do not want a hard spirit drink. I also like the fact that they are open until Midnight on Fri/Sat so that you can relax and enjoy.

I truly hope that my poor service experience is just a one time thing. I will be going back because the price is perfect and the assortment of wines is nice and the being open later is better.

If you want amazing service and great wines - earlier in the day - then I highly recommend Swirl on Castro. The service here rivals Blush but the down part is their wines are more expensive and not a lounge atmosphere, more of a Bevmo, buy and go type place. I wish we could fuse the two together and voila!
author: Kenneth E.

description: i wentt here to have a glass of wine to unwind after work-the workers hardly knew their selection my wine tasted like vinegar and he bathroom reeked of BM I alerted the staff about the bathroom and they seemed unconcerned they were over priced I was ignored and well I just doubt Will ever go back-the server or whatever took forever to give me a menu as they had friends there they would rather chat with and hey weren't customers but friends 'getting their hootch on' eww
author: Kitty L.

description: I can't say enough good things about Blush.  GREAT selection, chill and comfortable atmosphere, fantastic staff and owner, and nice nibbles.  Sometimes I wish the wines were "properly" chilled, but the ambiance makes up for it.  I think this is the most European place in SF, and I'll be back.  Frequently.
author: C. M.

description:
We stumbled upon this cute little place last weekend, and had a wonderful time. It has become my new favorite place in the city. Our server was very attentive, friendly, and super cute. Overall the place was welcoming, and not too pretentious. 
Worth a second visit.
author: Dr D.

description: Two thumbs up for Blush. What I like most is the ambiance. Super chill and comfortable. Great for a date or going out with a couple friends.
author: Susanna C.

description: Had a lovely time last night,  great atmosphere,  live music,  awesome staff.  will be sure to stop in again.  esp. after a movie at the Castro !@
author: tom s.

description: Great neighborhood place. Gabriel the bartender is straight but extremely nice and friendly, and if you call him Zsa Zsa (he's from Hungary) he'll never forget you. Try the Lady Slipper Pinot Noir.
author: Dan H.

description: Darn I missed being the first to review by a day! But then again, I don't usually venture to the Castro. Anyway, my bf and I were walking around trying to find a wine bar. We  yelped wine bars in the Castro area and some other name popped up...turns out it was what is now blush. Immediately walking inside, you are greeted with warm lighting, warmth, original artwork, and a generally homey atmosphere.  They have an old school espresso machine behind the bar. Have happy hour from 5-8, wine flights for $12, lists of wines by the glass as well as food. We were thinking of getting the cheese plate, which was $12, but judging on the enormous wedges of cheese and the time, we decided against it...However, seeing how large the portions are, I definitely want to go back when I'm hungry to sip wine and eat the cheese.  It wasn't crowded, but crowded enough. I liked how I had room to sit and now feel uber crowded like at the wine bars in the marina.
author: Natalie S.

description: Ok, so I love this place and have been going there ever since it opened. Lately thought it's been getting harder and harder to get a glass of wine. There's never anyone behind the counter and when there is it takes forever. I've had good experiences for the most part, but last night was horrible. It was like the waiters were having their own private party and ignoring the customers. I know that a couple of the waiters are straight and I felt like I was in a straight establishment. I'm all for integration, but at least stop flirting with the girls and get me my over priced glass of wine or go work at a straight bar!!!!
author: Doug W.

description: cute little spot that we happened to wander into...they had this happy hour special of this amazing champagne/violet/hard cider concoction...so yummy at only $3 a pop....mmmmmm The bartender was super nice and smart...and the music they were playing was very soothing yet upbeat...great artwork on the walls also...it's somewhere I would definitely go again...
author: Marla V.

description: i like this place, because it's a wine bar, but it has beer. really- i do not like wine, and so you would think i would not go in a wine bar. well, you're wrong. sometimes, you have to go with the crowd. and sometimes, you are up wine creek without alcohol, and that sucks. this place has beer. and a menu, and a couch, and yes, that's a good combo. and the beer is affordable, and the live music was listenable. nice.
author: green k.

description: My new favorite wine bar in the Castro! Great service, great food (the menu is expanding and keeps getting better), great atmosphere, great music, eclectic crowd. I LOVE this place! It gets better each time I go!
author: George F.
